headline: Five-Ingredient Monkey Bread
description: A delightfully gooey, pull-apart monkey bread recipe made easy with refrigerated biscuit dough and a simple cinnamon-sugar glaze.
name: Five-Ingredient Monkey Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a tube pan. Mix together 3/4 cup sugar and cinnamon.

Quarter biscuits with kitchen shears. Dip shears in water after each cut to keep biscuits from getting too sticky. Dip biscuits pieces into sugar mixture and place in prepared pan. Repeat until all biscuit pieces are used.
Melt margarine and mix in 3/4 cup sugar; pour mixture over biscuits in pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: it was delicious
I had expected a scratch recipe. Pre-made major ingredients (like the biscuits) do not exist in all areas. Rather disappointed.

This is a Christmas morning tradition at my house. And even though my kids are now 16 and 20, I almost had a mutiny on my hands when I suggested making pancakes or French toast this year! The only change I make to the recipe is to fill the pan with half the biscuits and then half the sugar/butter mix, then repeat the layers. It makes the gooey spread more evenly throughout.
Loved it and it came out so well. Easy to prep, easy to make.

I used to make this with my best friend and her mom, but I never looked for the recipe until now. I put it on a baking sheet and made it a pull-apart bread, and spread the extra cinammon and sugar across the top before putting the butter and sugar. Turned out fantastic!!

This recipe was delicious. Simple to make. I didn’t make any changes. I used to make this years ago for my kids. They loved it. Now I’m making it for my grandchildren. They enjoy helping me coat the pieces.
Not a fan. I made it Easter morning for breakfast and my hubby and I didn’t care for it and the kids wouldn’t even try it!
I love Monkey Bread so much.
This was delicious and my two year old loved helping out! And of course loved eating it!

Very good but too sweet even as a dessert. Next time I will add the butter to the remaining cinnamon/sugar mix and completely eliminate the rest of the sugar. I did, however, use the icing that came with the cinnamon biscuits which probably added quite a bit to the sweetness.

Pillsbury has come out with ‘sweet biscuits.’ I changed up the recipe with using one can of chocolate chip and one can of blueberry. I also used one can of cinnamon roll. I set the icings aside that each came with. I used a butter spray to grease my Bundt pan.
I found it a little dry. It could be using biscuit dough makes it dryer rather than bread dough.
I was really disappointed with this. The sugar/butter did not caramelize. Several of the bread prices were really dry.
Made according to recipe, and was absolutely delicious. Served at an event & the ladies were saying it was the best monkey bread they’ve ever had...& it was my first time to make it. Win!!

Recipe as written is great, but makes a LOT. If you, like us, are a smaller family, it easily cuts into thirds. I have even used a 5 ct tube of biscuits and adjusted all other ingredients for just hubs and I. Adjust your cooking time and your golden - no pun intended!
Very easy & delicious!
Used real biscuit dough and it was ok , needs tweaking. More sauce for sure and the dough needs more flavor (the biscuit recipe used is good).
Simple and to the point! Love this!!!!

I’ve found this recipe works great if you reduce the cinnamon to 2 teaspoons. I also skip the additional 3/4 cup of sugar. Instead, after dipping the dough in the cinnamon and sugar mixture, I mix whatever is left of the cinnamon sugar with the stick of melted butter.
Turned out good but seemed a bIt dry and would’ve rather been a bit more gooey !

Followed the directions exactly, except for a bundt pan instead of a loaf pan. This was really easy and turned out fantastic. My husband liked this one because it's not too sweet. I will certainly make this one again. I would recommend that you reduce the amount of sugar and cinnamon used to roll the dough in; I had at least a half cup of the mixture left after I finished putting the bread together.
the recipe was great. Instead of using the walnuts, I added mini chocolate chips and rolled the biscuit quarters into balls in order to stuff more chocolate chips inside.
I did not make any changes, but I suggest in this cold weather once it cools off from the oven eating it right away while it is warm and enjoying it as you grab pieces from the cake it is delicious!
I did not make any changes, but I suggest in this cold weather once it cools off from the oven eating it right away while it is warm and enjoying it as you grab pieces from the cake it is delicious!
I added the butter/sugar mixture to the middle as well so it was moist and yummy all the way through.

This was the first time I'd made Monkey Bread. I wasn't sure my husband would like it (he's not much for sweets), but he ate more than me. He loved it. I'm going to make more this weekend. I did notice that the butter/sugar mixture didn't really coat the bread so it wasn't gooey. The next time I'm going to use more butter and I'm going to reduce the baking time to 30 minutes.
I have always liked this recipe. This is a good recipe I've made many times.

The only change I made was using 2 16oz tubes of biscuit dough due to not finding 10 oz ones. I think I need to mix the glaze better next time as it came out thicker and formed more of an icing layer over the top than a glaze but it still tasted great!
I followed the recipe. Clearly the image shown was not to recipe as there was no brown sugar to make the caramel like topping.
super easy and very delicious

This was very good. I took the advice of other reviewers and used Buttermilk Grand biscuits. I recommend mixing the 3/4 cup sugar with cinnamon and after coating the biscuits, dump the rest over them in the pan. I added 1/4 cup brown sugar with the remaining 3/4 cup sugar and melted that in one cup of butter and poured that over the top before baking.

I've made this for years, and every time those who tried it loved it. I make three small changes and additions: I use some brown sugar in the sauce mixture; add some maple syrup in the sauce mixture; and as I'm layering the dough, I sprinkle in white chocolate chips throughout.
I love to make this recipe because it is easy to make and my family loves it.
Loved it. Minor changes based on the reviews. It was a hit with the whole family.

Better when its warm. Had to cook mine another 10 min. It was doughy under first layer. After cooking a second time I left it in oven while oven cooled down, then it was actually cooked.
Second day kind of dry.
This is a really good recipe. Every e who tried it loved it.
Excellent and easy recipe. I always add or tweak a recipe to my personal liking. But, family enjoyed it.
Tastes great! Add a little molasses to the mix and it is amazing!

Very easy. Get every thing set up ahead and use a zip top bag for the cinnamon sugar. Just drop a few pieces in and shake gently. Use tongs to get them out. I usually have all the ingredients on hand so it can be a spare of the moment creation. We love pecans or walnuts in ours. Been making this for years.
I baked the monkey bread just the way the recipe said. I was truly delicious and I would absolutely make this again

Relatively a quick and easy recipe. I added cranberries instead of raisins and walnuts. What I'd do differently is increase the butter/brown sugar mixture so the whole dessert is covered once it's on the plate. The bottom was dried out. It was a hit at work anyway!

I made recipe exactly as is. Am I only one who had the butter and sugar mixture leak out of bundt pan?? Had that not happened, I think it would have been better - middle pieces didn't have much flavor bc it seemed like it all leaked out. Also, top was kind of hard and I had to cook it long enough for inside to be done.
My 12 year old son made this himself and it came out really great, it was delicious

I have to give it a 5 Star
I made my first Monkey Bread ever for a pot luck at my senior center. There was nothing but a clean plate to take home. I thought it tasted great, was inexpensive, and easy to make. I didn't change anything in the recipe except I purchased two cans of biscuits (8 each) rather than the three (5 each). I had a lot of dipping sugar/cinnamon mix left over so I guess I will be making it again soon.
One thing I did differently, I used a chef knife and a cutting mat to quarter the biscuits and didn't have any trouble or need any water.
This is fun to make with the kids, so easy, and delicious. I think I'll make it again this weekend!
I used yeast rolls instead of biscuits
Just love it easy to make and all me family and friends loved it. Thanks

This is the perfect baking to do with two grandchildren (the little monkeys) coming to Grandma and Grandpa's for a sleepover. The six year old girl and her 4 year old brother loved coating the biscuit quarters with water then the cinnamon sugar mixture. by the time their parents came to pick them up we had a warm bundt cake ring of monkey bread. The children were proud and the monkey bread bits tasted as good as any cinnamon bun I have ever had.
Turned out very well and was very good.......and EASY too!!!
I always follow a recipe for the first time. This time I was pleasantly surprised to find that I can continue without changing the recipe at all. Very easy to make and delicious.
It was fantastic, eat while it is warm, added more butter to one stick, added extra light brown sugar and of course more cinnamon........loved it.
The recipe was great first time I made it was too sweet but after adjusting the sugars it was fantastic thank you so much.
This a great easy way to make a somewhat difficult cake : I added apples and raisins : the next time I'm going to put my big nuts in it - yummy .../;)

I absolutely loved it. I mixed in 1/4 c of brown sugar and only 1/2 c granulated with the melted butter. Then once it was done I melted 1/4c butter with sugar & dash of cinnamon to pour over the top after it cooled. I will DEFINITELY make it again!!! Thank you for sharing such a simple yet awesome recipe
Always a favorite! Doesn't last long! Sometimes I throw in raisins and chopped walnuts.
Excellent, rich and easy to make. Great as a desert with icecream and a cup of coffee.
It was a big hit for the football game.
Wouldn't bother to make it again. Though it was easy to put together, it was overly done on the top and bottom and under done in the middle.
Used butter instead of margarine because I was out of smart balance which I prefer to use. Prep time was way more than 5 minutes.
I added a few raisins and a few black walnuts,, man was it good,
I added chopped pecans and used the remainder of the sugar and cinnamon mixture with the butter.

I have made this for years but instead of dipping in water and pouring the butter over the whole thing and then add more sugar, I dip each piece of dough in the melted butter, then roll in sugar cinnamon mixture and place in pan. It turns out moist and sugary but not over the top sweet.

This was okay, but not really monkey bread. I've been making real monkey bread for years and it's much better than this. One of the best things about monkey bread is the yeast flavor. There was no yeast flavor in this at all.
It is delis try using brown sugar and maple syrup in the butter mixture
the sinful, simplest comfort food ever!!! my family absolutely loved it and its so easy! need lots of napkins.. or better yet, wet wipes .. but worth every bite!
Great holiday breakfast treat. I changed it up by using red & green decorative sugar on the top.

To make this taste like the Cinna buns 
Add 2 tablespoons cinnamon to sugar and butter 
Before melting to right before soft ball stage
Then pour on top of stacked dough
Cook shorter amount of time
This is always a hit at my house. The only thing I changed is I added pecan pieces, sprinkling them in on top the biscuit dough between layers.

This was an awesome recipe! I will be making this again! 

Thanks for the recipe! 

It tastes DELICIOUS!
i only used 1 tube of biscuits, decreased the sugar to 1/2 cup and the cinnamon to 2 Tbs. and cut the bake time by 5 minutes. very good
Swapped out half of the sugar for brown sugar and cooked for a little bit shorter time. I might even try covering it with foil next time to keep it more moist.
I made it just as it said and it was delicious.

i used cinnamon and brown sugar honey butter instead. and cut down the recipe and made 2 personal sized ones in a 2 cup round glass dish where i only used one package of dough. . the sugar and butter mixture made a chewy caramel which gave a nice crunch. i also cut down the cooking time to 20 minutes and it came out a little dark on top because the poured on mixture and it was a little tough to get out... had to scrape the side
My entire family loves this recipe! Its great for Christmas morning or any day. You can't go wrong with this recipe even if you change it a little bit, and the smiles are priceless!!!

This sounded delicious but was way dry. I grew up with monkey bread being gooey and delicious. It was just biscuits rolled in cinnamon and sugar. I would recommend either adding more butter in layers or rolling pieces in butter before adding cinnamon and sugar.
Out of the park...
i really like it
This was very easy to make and it turned out great.
EXCELLENT! My 8 year old loved helping me make these! The only thing I changed was I used brown sugar instead of white with the cinnamon!

Hands down best monkey bread I've ever made! I messed up and threw brown sugar in the ziplock bag so I just tossed in some white sugar, added the cinnamon and because I had too much I put half of it in a bowl for the next batch I'll make later. Used Pillsbury Buttermilk Grands (2 cans) because irs what I had here. I layered the sauce and the pecans between the tiers of biscuits. I cooked it for 30 minutes. Last 15 minutes in the oven I covered the pan with aluminum foil, and I put the bundt pan on a cookie sheet to prevent overflowing onto the oven floor. It's phenomenal! Husband isn't a fan of monkey bread but he loved this.
Quick and easy! Delicious!
Very easy and sooo good!!

SO DELIECIOUS!!!! I love sugar and I love bread, so i knew i just HAD to try this... I recommend using real butter instead of margarine, but other than that the recipe is perfect as it is, NO CHANGES NECESSARY. My family could not wait to eat this, and it was gone in 30 minutes. Im planning to make it again for my brother's golf tournament. Try it with chocolate chips!
Yum Yum Yum!! Easy too!!!

This is the recipe I've always made. But I will say one thing there is no need in cutting the dough. I just pull it apart with my hands and roll it in the sugar mixture. Just make sure you wash your hands before ;) Also I add a teaspoon of vanilla to the butter topping. Yummmmmy!
very good
A winner as always! I use 4 tubes of the cheap 4 pack biscuits and layer a little of the cinnamon sugar mixture on each layer as it gets put in.
A winner as always! I use 4 tubes of the cheap 4 pack biscuits and layer a little of the cinnamon sugar mixture on each layer as it gets put in.
Loved it!
Worked very well! Enjoyed by everyone!

I suggest that wetting the scissors while you cut the biscuits not only prevents sticking, but makes a moister product. I now dampen all sides of the biscuit with my wet fingers so that the sugar-cinnamon mix sticks better and the syrup forms more easily. Now I get perfect sticky-ness.
Quick, easy and delicious. What else can I say?
What I was looking for! My kids did most of the work and had a blast! Took it to church and got rave reviews!

Tasty. My kids loved making these. Next time, I would like to add the butter/sugar mixture on the bottom of the pan so when you turn it over, the glaze is on top. Not sure if this will work but its worth the try.

SOOO good! I think I just burnt off every taste bud on my tongue eating them within 30 seconds of coming out of the oven. 
I only used 2 cans of biscuits, since that's all I had. I cut each biscuit into quarters and rolled them in melted butter before rolling them in the cinnamon-sugar mixture. They turned out great, just like something I made when I was a kid!

This turn out to be exactly what I remember growing up. My children devoured this recipe within hours. And it was simple enough that my daughter could help with it. The only thing I changed was adding the cinnamon/sugar mixture to the melted butter and topping it that way instead of just sugar.

Really good out of the oven! I didn't use the other 3/4 cup of sugar mixed with butter; I used what was left of the cinnamon sugar mixture instead.
Still plenty sweet.
2/3/13- made again as written. Yummmmmmmm.

Love these! Reminds me of my childhood staying at my aunt's house! I have now started this tradition with my niece and nephew when they come to stay. My only change is to add in a bit of vanilla to the topping.
Awesome!
